intro: [WRONG START] Obernba behen subsp. antelopum, commonly known as the antelope milkweed, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, attracting pollinators such as butterflies and bees. Its latex sap is milky and can be toxic, a common feature among members of the Apocynaceae family. This species is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
